item.title: Wheres my book?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Orders ship within 24 hours of being placed. Shipping time in the US is usually less than a week; in the UK and Canada, shipping time is generally 7-10 business days. Elsewhere in Europe, shipping time can be 3-4 weeks. To all other locations, please allow 4-6 weeks for your book to arrive.

item.title: Where do you ship to?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: We ship books worldwide.

item.title: What do you charge for shipping?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded:
Shipping is calculated during checkout after you enter your shipping address; you will be able to review the shipping charges before placing your order. In the US, you may choose between the USPS or UPS for shipping for small orders; for orders over 10 books in the US, UPS shipping is required. Outside the US, orders ship via the USPS.
Note that we charge for shipping in line with our costs, and work to keep those costs as low as we can. International shipping prices are higher than we would like them to be, and we are looking into other options to reduce these costs including a European distributor. But for now, the USPS remains the most affordable way to get physical books to you around the world.

item.title: Whats my tracking number?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: For orders shipped via the USPS, no tracking information is provided; for orders shipped via UPS, tracking information will be sent to you when the order is shipped.

item.title: How do you handle international customs, taxes, or duties?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: We attach the appropriate customs forms to every international shipment and clearly label the contents as books; many countries do not levy customs taxes on the importation of books, so in most cases, no customs fees will be applied. That said, any import taxes charged by the destination country are your responsibility. Customs policies vary widely from country to country so if you have any concerns before you order, we recommend that you contact your local customs office.

item.title: Oops! I gave you the wrong shipping address.
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Ok; let us know your order number and the correct address, and well do our best to get it fixed up for you. Orders ship out very quickly, so theres no guarantee well be able to make corrections to an order before it ships.

item.title: I have a shipping address with non-Latin characters. Can you ship to it?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Unfortunately, we can only accept addresses using the Latin alphabet due to the rules of our shipping partners. All non-Latin character addresses will result in the order being non-deliverable.

item.title: I have a gift card. How do I redeem it?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: When you checkout, you can apply your gift card code after you enter your shipping and billing information (but before you confirm your order). Theres a specific field just for gift cards!

item.title: I bought a gift card for someone else. How do I share it?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: When you purchase a gift card, youll get an email with instructions on how to view, share, and print it. To share a gift card, simply forward that email to the recipient, or share the gift card link (also included in the email) directly.

item.title: I ordered the ebook. When will I get it?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Shortly after your order for the ebook goes through, youll receive an email with a link to download your book. Check your spam folder if you dont see it right away.

item.title: My cat ate my ebook files. Can I download the ebook again?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Yes, of course. Just visit this page and enter your order number and the email address used to place the order. Well give you a new link to download the files.

item.title: My download link expired; how can I download my ebook?
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Drop us a line with your order number (or the email address used to place the order), and well reset your download link.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

item.title: Live from the WordPress meetup!
item.dc:creator: jlambe
item.content:encoded: Tech Talk The Themosis PHP Framework looks like other modern PHP frameworks such as Laravel and it's designed specifically for WordPress. And it's made in Belgium. I'm very excited that theJulien Lamb, the creator of Themosis, has agreed to come and present the framework to the group. This will be a technical talk aimed at PHP developers or people that are learning PHP. Integer rhoncus ligula velit, et rhoncus urna molestie ac. Etiam convallis ac purus eu placerat.
